trans-unit.source: Specifies the details of a single typeface supported by a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref>.
There are as many FamilyTypeface objects as there are typefaces supported by the system.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypeface"></xref> class.
Gets a collection of localized face names adjusted by the font differentiator.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary%602> that represent the localized typeface names.
Gets or sets the distance from baseline to top of an English capital, relative to em size.
A value of type <xref:System.Double>.
Gets the collection of character metrics for a device font family typeface.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetricsDictionary"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name or unique identifier for a device font family typeface.
A value of type <xref:System.String> that represents the device font name.
Compares two font family typefaces for equality.
The <xref:System.Object> value that represents the typeface to compare.
if typeface is not null and has the same properties as this typeface; otherwise, .
Compares two font family typefaces for equality.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypeface"></xref> value to compare.
if typeface is not null and has the same properties as this font family typeface; otherwise, .
Serves as a hash function for a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypeface"></xref> object.
The GetHashCode method is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

The hash value is computed by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypeface.Style%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypeface.Weight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypeface.Stretch%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FamilyTypeface> object.
A value of type <xref:System.Int32>.
Gets or sets the designed stretch of the font family typeface.
The Stretch value describes the degree to which the font has been stretched compared to the font's normal aspect ratio.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretch"></xref>.
Gets or sets the position of the strikethrough value relative to the baseline.
The value is also relative to em size.
The value of StrikethroughPosition is usually positive in order to place the strikethrough above the baseline.
A value of type <xref:System.Double>.
Gets or sets the thickness of the strikethrough relative to em size.
A value of type <xref:System.Double>.
Gets or sets the style of the font family typeface design.
Describes the style of a font face, such as normal, italic, or oblique.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref>.
Gets or sets the position of underline value relative to the baseline.
The value is also relative to em size.
The value of UnderlinePosition is usually negative in order to place the underline below the baseline.
A value of type <xref:System.Double>.
Gets or sets the thickness of underline relative to em size.
A value of type <xref:System.Double>.
Gets or sets the designed weight of this font family typeface.
The Weight value describes the relative weight of a given font.
Weight differences are generally differentiated by an increased stroke or thickness associated with a given character in a font, as compared to a "normal" character from that same font.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref>.
Gets or sets the Western x-height relative to em size.
A value of type <xref:System.Double>.
